Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup; interior: black-figure decoration probably consisting of maenad and satyr side by side (of maenad, only part of garment and neck remaining; flesh in added white; of satyr, only lower part of face and beard remaining); exterior: glazed black.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 91 no. 313 pl. 68)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 441-2, no. B724, pl. XXIX, pl. CCXVIII)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1569) (phase 3)
